department.en: International Master of Business Administration program
department.ch: 國際經營管理碩士學位學程

goal.en: The MBA program is a research degree. Thus, an objective of this course is to help equip students with the basics to read and conduct research in real estate finance and investments and related topics. The lecturer(s) will also cover a portion of essential topics in real estate finance investments such as the mortgage loans, management of income producing properties and the alternative real estate financing and investment vehicles. Note: 1. This course will be taught in English. 2. Students are encouraged to use a financial calculator (BAII plus of Texas Instrument preferable) in class and for doing exercises.

content.en: The theory and practice of real estate finance and investments with an emphasis on features of mortgage loans, property valuation, and various management issues facing MBSs (mortgage-backed securities) and REITs (real estate investment trusts). This course also examines the topic of real options which builds on material covered in “Futures and Options”, e.g., to apply the binomial models for land evaluation, etc.

textbook.en: 1. Real Estate Finance and Investments, by William B. Brueggeman and Jeffrey D. Fisher, 17th Ed, McGraw- Hill Irwin: 2022. 2. Journal papers, mainly the recent ones published in Real Estate Economics.
